messages.text: Is there really a need for a function like that? Can’t it just be written using indexing with a range?

messages.text:
:til: you can use `dump` on a `DataType` , and it will not display the layout of the datatype, but give a generalized picture of the layout of instances of that datatype. Very useful! e.g.
```julia> dump(UnitRange{UInt8})
UnitRange{UInt8} <: AbstractUnitRange{UInt8}
  start::UInt8
  stop::UInt8```
Also, not documented :/

elements.text: , and it will not display the layout of the datatype, but give a generalized picture of the layout of instances of that datatype. Very useful! e.g.

julia> dump(UnitRange{UInt8})

  stop::UInt8
